Public NotInheritable Class WindowsAuthenticationElement Inherits ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Represents the Windows authentication element in a configuration file. This class cannot be inherited.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int DefaultCredentialsHandleCacheSize { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.DefaultCredentialsHandleCacheSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Defines the default size of the Windows credential handle cache.
Docs.value: The default size of the Windows credential handle cache.

remarks.format:
By default, Windows allocates a separate SSPI handle for each <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest>. If this behavior impacts performance, you can use the `DefaultCredentialsHandleCacheSize` to use a single cached SSPI credential handle for default network credentials. You can do this by setting this property value to 0. This corresponds to the following configuration setting:
```xml <system.net> <settings> <windowsAuthentication defaultCredentialsHandleCacheSize="0" /> </settings> </system.net> ```

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property Properties As ConfigurationPropertyCollection

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of properties that apply to this .
Docs.value: The collection of properties for this `WindowsAuthenticationElement` instance.

remarks.format: The `Properties` property, also called the property bag, contains all the properties (or attributes) that apply to the element. In the case of the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.WindowsAuthenticationElement> object, it contains a single <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationProperty> object that represents the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.WindowsAuthenticationElement.DefaultCredentialsHandleCacheSize> property.
